meanings.definition: A dense growth of shrubs or small trees.
meanings.sent1: The thicksets of bushes provided a safe hiding spot for the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The thicksets of trees in the forest created a beautiful natural barrier.
meanings.sent3: The thicksets of shrubs played hide and seek with the sunlight, casting shadows all around.
meanings.sent4: The thicksets of plants stood like an army, guarding the entrance to the secret garden.
meanings.sent5: The thicksets of greenery whispered secrets to the wind, rustling softly in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A compact or closely packed group of objects or people.
meanings.sent1: The thicksets of books on the shelf made it hard to find the one I needed.
meanings.sent2: The thicksets of students gathered around the teacher to hear the story.
meanings.sent3: The thicksets of toys in the playroom seemed to have a party of their own when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The thicksets of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton balls, floating lazily above.
meanings.sent5: The thicksets of buildings in the city created a maze of streets and alleys to explore.
